title: Chapter 2 – Review
description: Short-answer practice aligned to Chapter 2 outcomes. Includes conversions, unit arithmetic, and dosage practice.

easy.question: A pharmacist needs to prepare 100 tablets, each containing 20 mcg of a therapeutic agent. How many milligrams will be needed?
Add 2.25 L and 875 mL. Express the result in liters.
Add 0.0025 kg, 1750 mg, 2.25 g, and 825,000 μg, and express the answer in grams.
hints: Convert all values to grams, then add.

easy.question: An inhalation aerosol contains 5.28 mg fluticasone propionate for 120 inhalations. How many micrograms are in each inhalation?
hints: Divide mg by inhalations, then convert to mcg.

easy.question: Levothyroxine tablets are available from 25 to 300 μg. Express this range in milligrams.
hints: Convert μg to mg by dividing by 1000.

hard.question: TRIVORA-28: Phase 1 (6 tabs) 0.05 mg levonorgestrel + 0.03 mg ethinyl estradiol. Phase 2 (5 tabs) 0.075 mg + 0.04 mg. Phase 3 (10 tabs) 0.125 mg + 0.03 mg. Then 7 inert tabs. Calculate the total mg of each drug over 28 days.
hints: Multiply mg per tab × number of tabs per phase and sum.

hard.question: How many grams of digoxin are required to make 25,000 tablets, each 250 μg?
hints: Multiply tablets × μg, then convert to grams.

hard.question: Adalimumab syringe contains 40 mg/0.8 mL. What is the concentration in mg/mL?
A patient takes 50 μg/day ×2 days, 150 μg/day ×3 days, 250 μg/day ×3 days, 350 μg on day 9. What is the total dose in milligrams?
hints: Compute total μg and convert to mg.

hard.question: Digoxin injection 0.1 mg/mL. How many mL provide 40 μg?
hints: Convert μg to mg, then divide by concentration.

hard.question: ROXANOL solution: 0.6 g/30 mL. (a) mg/mL? (b) mg delivered in 0.6 mL?
hints: (a) convert g→mg, divide by 30. (b) multiply conc × 0.6.
